ARABIC: لِكُلِّ ٱمْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ شَأْنٌ يُغْنِيهِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: on that Day every man among them will have concerns enough of his own.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Each man will have enough cares that day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: on that Day each will be occupied with his own business, making him oblivious of all save himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: for on that day everyone will be completely engrossed in his own concerns.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: On that day, each one has just one issue, which is enough for him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Every man that Day will have enough to make him careless of others.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Every man of them shall on that day have an affair which will occupy him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: every man that day shall have business to suffice him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Every man that day will have concern enough to make him heedless (of others).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: on that Day every man among them will have enough concern of his own --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: For every one of them on that Day shall be business enough to occupy
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: each of them will have a task to keep him preoccupied on that day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Each one of them, that Day, will have enough concern (of his own) to make him indifferent to the others.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Everyman, that Day, will have enough to make him careless of others.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Everyone on that Day will have affairs to keep him occupied.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Every one of them, on that Day, will have enough to preoccupy him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [80:37] every person that day will have a matter to preoccupy him, a predicament to distract him from the affairs of others, in other words, every person will be preoccupied with his own self.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Every man that day) on the Day of Judgement (will have concern enough to make him heedless (of others)) to keep him preoccupied from others.
